subject: Re: [junit] Statement/branch coverage?
msgSnippet: ... Yes, this is true, JUnit only runs your tests and reports test execution results. ... There exists quite a few code coverage tools for java out there,
messageBody:
> I'm new to JUnit. From what I have been able to find out so far it appears
> that JUnit can not report any kind of test coverage statistics against the
> source (for example statement or branch coverage). Is that true?

Yes, this is true, JUnit "only" runs your tests and reports test
execution results.

> If it is,
> do you know of a tool that does this for Java? There is such a tool for C++.

There exists quite a few code coverage tools for java out there,
either in standalone form or as modules for IDE (eg. Eclipse,
Intellij, Netbeans, whatever) or build systems (ant,maven, buildr,
scons, whatever). Check Cobertura, Emma, djUnit, Eclemma for
free/open-source tools, or Clover for payware.

HTH

Arnaud
